page.title: 14HOCKHAM FARM PIGGERIES
page.content:
Slaughtering:
At 28 weeks, when the pigs weigh 75-80 kg, they are slaughtered by Lloyd Maunder at Willand. The pork and bacon is then sent direct to supermarkets. The heifers are sent back to a dairy farmer at Chard.
Pigs:
The sows are reared on the farm. They produce up to 11 litters. The pure Welsh pigs are mated with a cross between a Hampshire and a large white. The boars used are the Suffolk large boar and the crossbow. After weaning the piglets are kept in a shed at 20 degrees Centigrade.
